dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing - icily) How long ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fifteen minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure? Carol nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing - with quick calculation) He'd figure you for longer, enough time to try another hit. He's probably still in the station. As Doc pushes Carol forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing - lashing out) There better be a guy with the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (lashing back) You bastard... Walking at a rapid pace, they start through the station, forcing their speed, clutching Carol under her elbow. The reach the main concourse after moving down the length of promenade... eyes straining. CAROL STOPS SUDDENLY. SHE STARES DOWN THE LONG CORRIDOR h eyes finding the thief. He stands near another bank of lockers, the black suitcase at his feet. THE THIEF LOOKS UP AT CAROL - virtually within the same moment that she spots him. His expression never changes. takes a step towards her, smiling... Then, with a movemen that is both abrupt and casual, he snatches up the money and disappears behind the constant traffic of train patro DOC HAS SEEN THE THIEF. Recognizing the suitcase he moves immediately after him. Carol follows Doc but is unable to keep up. She watches as Doc vanishes behind the row of lockers. CAROL ROUNDS THE LAST LOCKER IN THE ROW but both men have disappeared from view. She sags back against the edge of metal compartments, exhausted, fearful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (indistinct above the roar of the station) Attention please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Flyer now boarding at gate three. The Flyer now boarding at gate three. Carol again raises her eyes. Still breathless, her face g with moisture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRAN IS STILL SEATED ON THE STOOL. Rudy stares at her fro the cot. Harold is now absent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think you have to worry much about Harold. He won't do anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (he speaks very politely) That right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can trust him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long have you been married?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can he trust you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles) That's what matters, isn't it? Rudy continues looking at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come over here a minute... He gestures with his gun. Fran crosses the distance slowl moving with apprehension.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I'm not going to be any trouble to you either, fact is, this may sound funny, but maybe you and I could be close friends... Rudy gestures her closer...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) You don't always have to have your gun out. I'll get whatever you want. Really, I will... Fran smiles. She is now standing over the cot, looking directly down at Rudy. He jerks her down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still polite) Get rid of that nail polish, I don't like it, and when I tell you to come over here you move fast. You and I are going to get along because I've known a lot of people like you, so don't tell me about it because I got your ticket going in. Now get up and get that paint of your fingers... okay? Rudy smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOC MOVING LIKE A GUN DOG ON THE HUNT between the rows of lockers; catching sight of the thief momentarily, he clos in. After a series of criss-crossed movements among the banke locker corriders, Doc again loses sight of the thief as t slender criminal dodges off onto a main passenger concour Doc is faster and more agile than the thief, but the stat is unfamiliar territory to him. Both Doc and the Thief mo carefully, they must not arouse enough attention to make themselves conspicuous, thus risking police interference. THE THIEF HURRIES ALONG THE MAIN CONCOURSE weaving betwee the incoming and departing passengers that dot the long corridor. DOC IN PURSUIT DOWN THE CONCOURSE, he passes several seal off departure/arrival gates. THE THIEF STEPS OFF THE CONCOURSE INTO GATE THREE, an ope stairway winding downward. DOC FOLLOWS HIS QUARRY DOWN THE STAIRWAY to the train are where he immediately skips over the winding ramp and onto loading platform. Emerging from the short tunnel, Doc isn surprised that the Thief is again nowhere in sight. Doc s behind a pillar -- he waits watchfully... After a moment two, the Thief edges out from behind another column and starts back up the platform towards the concourse.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Doc moves quickly to intercept his opponent but, as the T spots his approach, he turns and Joins several passengers scurrying toward the awaiting train... THE FLYER STANDS GLEAMING AT TRACKSIDE, perpendicular to boarding gate. Two doors to the train stand open, one in pullman section, the other entrance admitting day coach passengers.

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: about-to-depart passengers... the Flyer comes into sight, visible on the next level below. THE CONDUCTOR - AT TRACKSIDE - STANDS SMILING BROADLY by coach entrance. He grins at the boarding PASSENGERS as he speaks to a nearby BRAKEMAN. The Thief skirts around a baggage-laden elderly COUPLE and moves up the two-step an into the rail car passageway. DOC MOVING QUICKLY AGAIN. He sees the Thief slip past the conductor and into the train. THE THIEF IS NOW INSIDE THE DAY COACH. He heads toward th forward compartments. DOC EXPERTLY SQUIRMS THROUGH THE BOARDING THRONG and disappears past the conductor up into the passenger car vestibule.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE CONCOURSE
dialogues.text: CAROL WATCHES AS A BLONDISH MAN in a grey suit skips aboa the Flyer standing below. She is unable to get a clear lo at the man, and is unsure as to whether or not it was Doc She hesitates, then moves forward to Gate Three which wil take her down to trackside... Carol stands at the edge of the gate -- the last of the c having already passed through. She hesitates again, stari down at the shining train.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE AISLE IS CLOGGED WITH PASSENGERS. People hesitate ove their selection of seats, put baggage into overhead racks clumsily remove their overcoats... The Thief continues to move forward, squirming around the passengers at a hurrie but controlled pace.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE END OF A PULLMAN
dialogues.text: DOC ENTERS, THREADING HIS WAY FORWARD, scanning faces. He one car behind the Thief and losing ground, due to the fa that Doc must carefully note the occupants of each seat a passes. Doc is further delayed by a WOMAN blocking the ai She struggles painfully, trying to fit a suitcase into an overhead carriage. Doc, with the most forced of smiles, reaches up to help h 30? THE THIEF MOVES THROUGH ANOTHER VESTIBULE and into an empty car -- now unobserved, he immediately breaks into a run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The passengers have become fewer and fewer as he nears th front of the train.

dialogues.speaker: THE THIEF RUNS THROUGH ANOTHER VESTIBULE AND INTO A SMOKE
dialogues.text: This car also deserted, he maintains his trotting pace, swinging the heavy suitcase as he goes... reaching the en the smoker, he enters the next vestibule and attempts to into the following car, but the Thief is brought to a hal the sudden dead end of the passageway. The next car holds only baggage. He has reached furthest forward passenger c The Thief desperately tries to open the vestibule door, hoping to escape by jumping off the train, but the doors tightly locked. He begins to retrace his steps. DOC MOVES CAREFULLY INTO THE NEXT CAR FORWARD, still unknowingly two cars behind the Thief.

dialogues.speaker: THE THIEF PASSES BACK TO THE VESTIBULE AT THE REAR OF THE
dialogues.text: SMOKER, his eye suddenly catching the Men's Lounge. He tr the door -- locked. The Thief snaps out a pen knife, pick the lock with a deft movement. Passengers are visible beh him as he works, filtering into the pullman car following smoker. None of them notes his activity. The restroom doo swings open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Thief immediately snaps the bolt-lock shut behind him crosses the small, murky room and tries to lift the windo He strains mightily but the glass remains hopelessly jammed... DOC ENTERS THE FINAL PASSENGER CAR, notes the half 313 do travelers and continues moving forward, going next into t smoker.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: THE SMOKING CAR IS EMPTY, although several Passengers and PORTER enter it moments after Doc leads the way. Doc pass through the length of the car, moves into the vestibule a like the Thief a few moments before, finds his passage blocked by the baggage car. Doc hesitates, then turns and begins going back in the opposite direction. DOC STOPS AT THE MEN'S LOUNGE -- staring hard at the door a moment. He tries the handle. The door remains firmly sh

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (appearing suddenly at Doc's shoulder)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be open five minutes out of the station. Doc nods and moves away, continuing to retrace his steps toward his point of entrance onto the train. THE THIEF, HAVING ABANDONED THE JAMMED WINDOW, is now und the snaps and straps holding the suitcase closed. The lid pulls upward and stacks of money appear under his hands. Thief grabs a money pad, runs his thumb over it, then sho the stack of greenbacks into his coat's inside breast poc DOC MOVES WITH DETERMINATION back through the passenger c

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE THIEF HAS AGAIN CLOSED THE SUITCASE. He nervously loo about his tight-walled sanctuary, then crosses back to th window and stares out through a corner of the pane. He pu the shade lower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: METAL WHEELS GRIND AGAINST THE RAILS, the train SHUDDERS, then begins to move forward. THE THIEF IS WATCHING THROUGH THE MEN'S ROOM WINDOW as th train edges forward. His body suddenly tightens. He sees outside the train, walking slowly between a narrow passag moving passenger cars and several parked tinders.

dialogues.speaker: DOC GLANCING BETWEEN PARKED PASSENGER
dialogues.text: CARS, walking cautiously ahead. As the Flyer continues to move slowly forward, Doc disappears from view. THE THIEF ALLOWS HIMSELF A QUICK SMILE. Turning away from window he picks up the suitcase, unbolts the lock and ste back out into the vestibule.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: AT THE BACK OF THE SMOKER, the Thief seats himself next t window and places the suitcase on the cushioned chair opposite from him. In the forward position of the car, we behind the Thief's back, a dozen Passengers are scattered about the lounge chairs. A Conductor appears at the end o the smoker opposite the Thief and begins to collect and p tickets. As the train begins to pick up speed, the Thief lifts an abandoned copy of the newpaper off the cushion next to hi He glances at the front page, then unfolds the width of t paper. As a precaution against regaining poverty, the Thi rests one foot against the suitcase. All seems secure. Th Doc sits down next to the Thief.

dialogues.speaker: DOC COMPANIONABLY SLIDES AN ARM BEHIND THE BACK OP THE
dialogues.text: THIEF'S NECK, pulling him close. DOC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly almost gently) When you pop a lock don't mark it. The Thief's knife instantly flashes into his hand, but be he can bring it into play, Doc catches his arms. THE KNIFE IS TIGHTLY WEDGED INTO THE THIEF'S HAND. Doc's fingers are vise-like at his wrist. THE OTHER PASSENGERS REMAIN PRE-OCCUPIED AT THE OTHER end the car, taking no note of the quiet encounter. THE CONDUCTOR IS STILL AT THE OPPOSITE END OF THE CAR fro Doc and the Thief. He continues collecting and punching fares.

dialogues.speaker: CAROL IS EXITING. THERE IS AN ANNOUNCEMENT OVER THE
dialogues.text: LOUDSPEAKER -- the train has left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE CONDUCTOR AS SEEN BY THE THIEF'S WIDENING EYES. He methodically punches the tickets, never looking more than seats ahead. THE THIEF'S EYES BULGE AS DOC CHOPS HIM ON THE WINDPIPE. Thief goes out. Is he dead? DOC CHOPS HIM AGAIN. IF HE ISN'T DEAD HE LOOKS IT. Doc pulls the Thief's hat down over his head.

dialogues.speaker: CAROL CROSSES INTO THE STATION, TAKES A DEEP BREATH.
dialogues.text: Sits... waiting. The soldier comes by, stops. She doesn't recognize anything.

dialogues.speaker: THE CONDUCTOR ARRIVES AT THE LOUNGE CHAIRS WHERE DOC AND
dialogues.text: thief are seated. He stops in the aisleway, expectantly leaning in Doc's direction. CONDUCTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tickets? As Doc takes out his wallet, peels a fifty out and gives to him. DOC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: End of the line. Two. CONDUCTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grumpily) All right. The conductor cuts the fare receipt and begins to make change.

dialogues.speaker: RUDY SITS IN THE BACK SEAT AS HAROLD CAUTIOUSLY MOTORS
dialogues.text: DOWN the highway. With his one good arm, Rudy cares for t kitten resting in the cardboard box on the back seat. RUDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talk a little, Harold, loosen up... good for you. Harold works his jaw, his grip tightens on the wheel. FRAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (chuckling at Harold) Something ought to loosen him up ... how comes we're going to El Paso, Rudy? RUDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I Just want to find a suitcase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BEYNON'S BODY REMAINS OUT OF SIGHT behind the overturned kitchen table... a small trickle of blood oozes out from under one of the table legs. The Accountant stands with Cully, Hayhoe and Swain starin down at Beynon's body. ACCOUNTANT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They may still be going to Nogales. SWAIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Laughlin in El Paso? ACCOUNTANT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cover both, get someone down there... either Rudy and McCoy's got half a million. SWAIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They've got to switch cars. ACCOUNTANT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put out the word. HAYHOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking back at Beynon) What about Jack? ACCOUNTANT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tonight... take him out in the country, throw him down a dry well, if you can find one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AS DOC THUMBS IDLY THROUGH THE NEWSPAPER. He is suddenly showered with spurting water. He lowers the paper and loo to the aisle, seeing: A SEVEN YEAR OLD BLACK PANTHER, dressed appropriately and holding a water pistol. KID

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stick 'em up! Doc looks at the brat. KID (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) I'm gonna shoot you...

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He squeezes the pistol's trigger, two bursts of water lan Doc's shirt front. Doc continues staring at the boy. The looks hard at Doc, not giving an inch. DOC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come here a second... Doc takes the boy's arm, gently pulls him closer. DOC (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Look, I'm sure you're a nice kid and that your mother's nearby... Now you better get back to her real quick or I'm going to break your little arm... okay? Doc releases the boy. The kid looks at Doc for a moment t bursts into tears and retreats at a dead run back down th passenger car aisleway. Doc again lifts the paper, turnin the sports page.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOC LIFTS THE SUITCASE AS THE CONDUCTOR APPEARS at the vestibule at the opposite end of the car and announces th next stop. Doc prepares to get off. The passenger car rem sparsely populated. No one occupies the seats near the corpse.

dialogues.speaker: EARLY MORNING
dialogues.text: CAROL SITS WATCHING THE PEOPLE -- she gets up, doesn't kn where to go... sits down again... fear and anticipation o her face... stands up... ready to go where? Ready to sit again, she looks up. DOC CROSSES SLOWLY TO HER CARRYING THE SUITCASE. Carol reacts... pleased to see him... pleased that he's back... until. DOC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (steely) Your kind of mistakes are going to land me back in Huntsville.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: CAROL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nailing him) I wouldn't worry Doc. I can always get you out... I'll screw every prison official in Texas if I have to. DOC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Texas is a big state. CAROL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can handle it. DOC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll bet you can. CAROL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd do the same for me, wouldn't you, Doc? (rising tone) If I was caught, wouldn't you? Doc is silent. After a long pause. CAROL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing - quietly) When we had trouble before it was different. DOC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nodding) You don't like the way things are, I don't like the way things CAROL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want to do? DOC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe we should split up... I'll cut the money with you. CAROL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you mean that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean it. A long pause. Maybe she wonders; what if he is lying but if he isn't? Temptation? She makes up her mind. CAROL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... I don't want to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOC AND CAROL WATCH THROUGH THE DOUBLE WINDOWS AS THE tra yard lights of a town go strobing by. EXT. SECOND TRAIN CONCOURSE. DOC AND CAROL COME DOWN OUT OF THE GANGWAY OF ANOTHER tra and turn up the pavement toward the main part of the depo Doc continues holding the suitcase as they walk. DOC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll grab a room for tonight then you go out tomorrow and buy yourself some new clothes, pick some up for me... Grab some food now, paper bag it, we eat in the room. CAROL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cutting in) You've got all the answers. What about when they find the body on the train? DOC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When they find it, they find it. To the cops a description's only good if there's a channe for it, and there's no connection between that stiff and robbery. CAROL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got it all figured. DOC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at Carol and thinking about Beynon) No... there's a couple of things I'm still working on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like what? But Doc doesn't answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOC LIES NEXT TO CAROL. Carol is eating a hamburger wrapp in wax paper. She passes one over to Doc along with some greasy french fries and a couple of napkins . The Suitcase has been placed on the small writing desk ac the room. Doc silently munches his hamburger.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Doc glances at the poster rolled up. Carol hasn't put it on the wall yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE TRAIN GOES CLICKETY CLICK THROUGH THE NIGHT, the youn panther is stalking and prowling among the sleeping passengers. His Mother catches him, takes him back to his seat.

dialogues.speaker: CAROL IS BUSY UNBANDING THE MONEY PADS. A LARGE STACK OF
dialogues.text: discarded wrappers have been placed in a metal trash can her leg. Behind her, Doc, now in his undershirt, reads a Texas newspaper. CAROL CONTINUES TO LOOSEN THE GREENBACKS. She is surround on the double bed by stacks of money. She lights a match, drops it into the wastebasket. The money bands quickly bu into flames, consume themselves, then die back into crink ashes. DOC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not looking up) There may be a hunting party. CAROL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why, there's nothing on the news? DOC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't mean police. He continues thinking. Carol watches him for a moment. CAROL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me about it. Doc looks across at her. DOC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calmly) Loredo is out. I've been thinking about Rudy. If he was on his own, we're okay. If Beynon bought him out... Doc looks at her. CAROL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: DOC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If Beynon bought him out, and he talked then maybe Beynon's boys will be waiting for us in El Paso. Rudy knew about Laughlins. CAROL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're full of ifs. DOC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you liked it with him. I think he got to you. CAROL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe. At least I got to him. (pause) Where do we go from here? DOC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: El Paso.

dialogues.speaker: A WATER PISTOL APPEARS AROUND THE CORNER OF AN EMPTY
dialogues.text: PASSENGER CHAIR. The seven year old brat   squeezes off s plumes of water. The Thief is hit by the   gun's spray, w runs slowly down his ear and the back of   his neck. KID

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bang! THE BOY WATCHES THE IMMOBILE MAN. He fires again, once ag there is no reaction. The brat steps forward... smiling, pushes the thief's arm, pushes harder. THE THIEF'S BODY SUDDENLY FALLS BACK ACROSS THE CHAIR. Hi eyes roll upward... staring at the panther. His neck is bruised, he pushes his hat back slowly. THIEF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (very hoarsely) Get me a doctor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAROL SLEEPS ON HER STOMACH, her head resting across one Doc lies beside her, eyes open. He looks over at Carol a moment, noting the long strands of hair that move rhythmically back and forth from her gentle breathing. Af a moment Doc quietly stands, moves to the writing table a stares at the black suitcase.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He opens the valise and lifts the large stack of greenbac into a shaft of light coming through a crack in the drawn shade. Still holding the money, Doc looks back at Carol.

dialogues.speaker: ONE LAST TIGHTLY BOUND MONEY PAD
dialogues.text: Printed clearly on the brown wrapper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A PLAINCLOTHES OFFICER HOLDS A SIMILAR MONEY PAD with his handkerchief. The Panther is sitting with his mother on a nearby seat. Still dressed in his panther suit, but no lo a brat. His face reflects both fear and shock.

dialogues.speaker: THE THIEF IS WITH THEM, BANDAGED AROUND THE THROAT
dialogues.text: PLAINCLOTHES OFFICER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the Thief) Where did you get it? THIEF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hoarsely) It was a gift.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAROL COMES IN. SHE IS WEARING A NEW SUIT, SANDALS It loo great... She tosses a package on the bed. Doc looks at her outfit and opens his. They are too flash DOC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. (as Carol starts to speak) You look great, just great... They could pick you up for soliciting in ten minutes. CAROL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That would be the first time. DOC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (angry) When are you going to learn? CAROL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did I killed a man.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Doc throws his clothes away. DOC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing) And that could be all for you., baby. Carol suddenly angered slaps him. Doc immediately delivers her a stinging blow. Carol hits the wall then stands stunned as he quietly tie his laces and pulls on his jacket. Doc stuffs the Colt .4 into the flapped outside pocket along with 2 clips. He tu to the bed and picks up the suitcase. Carol continues looking at Doc. DOC (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now you learn3 this time it could be the chair for both of us. Carol starts to speak. DOC (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) From now on you just shut up and do as you're told. CAROL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I hadn't killed Beynon., you would have. Doc doesn't answer. He turns and exits. She follows.

dialogues.speaker: PICTURES OF MEN LOOKING SOMETHING LIKE DOC.
dialogues.text: Printed at one side of the photographs are their criminal records.

dialogues.speaker: THE SENIOR DETECTIVE AND THE TWO PLAINCLOTHES
dialogues.text: OFFICERS are seated within the Communication room of the department. The transcriber comes to life as the cylinder receiver begins to turn.

dialogues.speaker: THE CYLINDER RECEIVER
dialogues.text: THE CYLINDER NOW REVEALS DOC MeCOY'S FACE.

dialogues.speaker: CONDUCTOR, MOTHER AND SON AND THIEF
dialogues.text: Yes, that's him. No question about it. That's him. DETECTIVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing to the thief) How about him? THIEF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hoarsely) Listen, I'm a friend of the Court. DETECTIVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are here because you're under arrest.

dialogues.speaker: A TRANSISTOR RADIO
dialogues.text: ON A BEDSTAND. THE FREQUENCY HAND INDICATOR GLOWS with a yellow light. RADIO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... The man has been positively identified as Carter Doc" McCoy, only recently paroled from a penitentiary where he was serving time for armed robbery. He is believed to be travelling with his wife, Carol Ainsley McCoy... (ad libs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RUDY REACHES OVER TO THE NIGHTSTAND AND SHUTS OFF the rad His eyes stare vacantly ahead for a moment. HAROLD CLINTON IS TIED SECURELY INTO A CHAIR, his mouth tightly gagged. RUDY BEGINS TO SMILE. FRAN IS NEXT TO RUDY WITHIN THE bed wearing only a bra, sleeping, one arm wrapped around Rudy middle. RUDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How you doing over there, Harold? You sleep okay last night? Good. I'm glad to hear it. Did you listen to the news? That means we don't have to drive so hard today, Harold... we're gonna be travelling a lot faster than they are... We got a lot more time than I figured.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Rudy continues smiling. He pulls the sheet away from Fran then allows his hand to reach down, cupping her breast fr inside the bra. Fran half awakens, pulls herself closer t Rudy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HAYHOE, THE ACCOUNTANT and the rest of the boys are sitti in the office waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RUDY IS DRIVING NOW, Fran and Harold are not speaking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOC AND CAROL. DOC IS DRIVING. They are also silent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CANNON (one of the Accountant's boys, whom we have not se before) ENTERS THE DARK NEARLY DESERTED LOBBY and approac the reception desk. The large room is populated by overstuffed and threadbare furniture. LAUGHLIN looks very much like Dub Taylor and speaks Spani just about as badly. He flashes a quick grin from behind counter as Cannon draws near. At the switchboard behind Laughlin, CARMEN, maybe 35, sits next to the telephone ja (all of them idle) readinc a movie magazine. CANNON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You Laughlin? LAUGHLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Mr. Friendly) Yes, sir, and that's my wife and that's Junior. Laughlin indicates a seventeen year old BELLBOY sleeping one of the overstuffed chairs. CANNON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Congratulations. I need a room. LAUGHLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No trouble. You came to the right place, one thing we got is a lot of rooms. What else can I do for you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AS IT MOTORS DOWN THE TEXAS HIGHWAY. The black suitcase i propped up between Doc and Carol in the front seat. Doc, seated on the passenger side, bangs the car radio with hi hand. The radio is obviously not working as he turns the dials and pushes the buttons. DOC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cajoling it) C'mon workl I (almost pleading) C'mon. We hear garbled words for a moment, pleasing Doc... and t the radio conks out again. This time Doc hits the radio h DOC (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (angrily to the radio) Give me the news!! When it is clear that the radio won't work: DOC (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't trust anything these days. CAROL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll tell you something, Doc. One day you're going to have to trust somebody... DOC SLAMS THE BRAKE, GRABS THE WHEEL as the car veers ove the side of the road. DOC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I trust... (he opens the black suitcase) Want to see what I trust... In God we trust... (he pulls out a bill and points at it) The word's on every bill!!! CAROL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slamming the suitcase closed) You keep it up and it won't matter how far we get away, because it's going to be all over between you and me. Do you understand that? There won't be anything left. She starts the car up again, and continues driving, her knuckles tightening around the steering wheel.

dialogues.speaker: AS IT LEISURELY MOVES ALONG THE ROADWAY BORDERED BY MILES
dialogues.text: SAGEBRUSH. Harold drives, Fran is again in the front seat beside her husband... a scrunched up sack of food beside She wipes her mouth with a napkin, shoves it inside the p bag, then turns to watch the passing scenery. Rudy sits i the back, eating spareribs. He suddenly throws a just finished bone at Fran, hitting her on the shoulder. RUDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have a bone, baby. He throws another sparerib at Fran. FRAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouts) Oh, Christ, you wrecked my blouse. God damn it, Rudy, what did you do that for? Jesus. RUDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing) I'll tell you why I did it... it makes me feel good. He laughs and again throws another bone at Fran. She sudd catches his mood and begins laughing herself ... tossing bone back at Rudy. HAROLD CONTINUES DRIVING. His knuckles whiten around the steering wheel as a sparerib bounces off the window in fr of him. THE KITTEN IS SLEEPING WITHIN the cardboard box, obliviou Rudy and Fran's laughter. (That will be the day.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE CHEVY MOVES ALONG with the light mid-day traffic, pas various roadside business establishments, then pulls up before a radio/TV repair and sales shop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALL THE LATEST MODEL RADIOS are stacked on shelves around small room... a television display featuring several mode is in one corner of the shop. Another TV is playing near counter and the PROPRIETOR'S desk. DOC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A portable.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: PROPRIETOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Transistor? DOC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. The Proprietor moves to a shelf. THE SCREEN. As Doc's picture suddenly flashes onto the tu with appropriate dialogue. DOC STARING AT THE TELEVISION, then he quickly reaches ov and snaps the set off. THE PROPRIETOR BRINGS OUT SOME RADIOS, seemingly obliviou Doc's action. PROPRIETOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 15 to 55 dollars -- take your pick. DOC TURNS, then looks at the corner of the small shop. ALL THE TELEVISION SETS have Doc's picture on them. DOC TURNS BACK TO THE PROPRIETOR -- the man is looking at not at the sets. DOC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (paying) Fifty -- Taking a set, he exits. PROPRIETOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have change. But he doesn't answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAROL TURNS AS DOC STICKS HIS HEAD through the open door, hands her the set. DOC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got trouble. Let's take a walk. DOC AND CAROL WALKING UP THE SIDEWALK OP THE SMALL TOWN. turn into a Sporting Goods Store. The Chevy is behind the block away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE PROPRIETOR LOOKS CAREFULLY OUT THE WINDOW AT THE empt car, then turns and grabs his telephone.

dialogues.speaker: CAROL REMAINS BY THE FRONT WINDOW, PRETENDING TO
dialogues.text: EXAMINE some fishing equipment as she keeps her eye on th street. Doc moves to the counter at the rear of the store. An ATTENDANT moves up to help Doc. SALESMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with a smile) Can I help you? DOC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure can. I'd like an Invicta 12-gauge pump with the twenty-inch barrel. SALESMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right. Shells? DOC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two boxes of double-ought buck. SALESMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gonna knock down a wall? DOC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (big smile) Might try that. The Salesman puts a form in front of Doc then goes to the rack behind him, lifts off a short-barreled shotgun and begins to wrap it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sign here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE RADIO-REPAIRMAN EXITS THE SHOP AS A POLICE CAR comes the street and makes a U-turn... stopping near the Chevy. After a brief conversation the Radio-Repairman goes back inside his store and the police car pulls forward, down t street from the Chevy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE TWO COPS LOOK LIKE HOMER AND JETHRO. Both men stare h at the now staked-out Chevy.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE COUNTER THE SALESMAN LAYS OUT THE GUN AND THE BOXE
dialogues.text: SHELLS. As Doc empties the loose shells into his coat poc CAROL TURNS, LOOKS AT DOC, THEIR EYES MEET. Doc reads her knows that the police are in the street.

dialogues.speaker: PAPER
dialogues.text: SALESMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be one hundred and eighty-five thirty- two. Doc quickly pays the man. DOC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Much obliged. Doc turns as the Salesman drifts over to another Customer he approaches Carol at the store window. CAROL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only one car. DOC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's do it. Carol moves ahead of Doc,, exits the Sporting Goods Store starts up the sidewalk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HOMER AND JETHRO CONTINUE STARING AT THE CHEW. Their car pointed towards the Radio Store, its back to the Sporting Goods house. DOC LEAVES THE SPORTING GOODS STORE, CROSSES THE STREET a begins walking up the opposite sidewalk, back towards the Chevy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE TWO RURAL COPS MOVE INTO ACTION; their car pulls forw and parks diagonally across the street, partially blockin the roadway as xvell as nearly obstructing the Chevy.

dialogues.speaker: CAROL STANDS FROZEN AS HOMER AND JETHRO HOP OUT OF THE PO
dialogues.text: car, guns drawn.

dialogues.speaker: DOC CROSSES THE STREET BEHIND THE COP CAR
dialogues.text: HE LEVELS HIS big gun... Doc FIRES the shotgun through the "brown wrapping paper p blank into the squad car, caving in one side of the machi and blasting the radiator into a steaming wreck. Homer and Jethro hit the ground, paralyzed with fright as their car EXPLODES behind them. With three more BLASTS Doc blows most of the top off the police car then calmly reloads. DOC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slide those guns! The two cops send their guns clattering across the paveme CAROL HAS INSTANTLY MOVED BACK INTO THE CHEVY, started th engine and begun maneuvering it out onto the street. She makes a U-turn, then pulls up near Doc. DOC STEPS FORWARD, KICKS THE TWO PISTOLS BACK UNDER the police car near the gas tank. He walks to the back of the car. Carol throws open the passenger door of the Chevy. Doc SHOOTS the gas tank of the squad car, it instantly ignites. Walking calmly around the burning police car Doc then sta to climb into the Chevy. Carol REVS the engine. Doc pauses a moment, looking back at the prone police officers and the blazing automobile.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Carol guns the car forward -- Doc, unprepared for the Che sudden movement, falls flat on his face across the paveme CAROL THROWS THE CHEVY INTO REVERSE, AND ROARS back to pi up Doc. DOC, A LITTLE CHAGRINED, PICKS HIMSELF UP, GRABS his gun jumps into the Chevy. He slams the door closed, Carol aga tears forward -- tires peeling down the pavement. HOMER AND JETHRO RAISE THEMSELVES. With very long faces t study the burning remains of their once proud squad car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE CHEVY SPEEDS OUT OF TOWN,, onto an open stretch of ro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOC JAMS ONE MORE SHELL INTO HIS PAPER-WRAPPED gun -- Car grips the wheel tightly concentrating on the road... the Chevy continues to accelerate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE CHEVY CROSSES THE ROAD'S BROKEN WHITE LINE and passes lumbering Greyhound bus. DOC, STARING AT THE HIGHWAY BEHIND THEM; the bus fades of into the horizon...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (finally) Here. THE CHEVY PULLS OFF THE HIGHWAY, MOVES UP A DIRT road for twenty yards then pulls into a cornfield of a well laid o farm, smashing through the six foot high stalks. Well out sight, the Chevy slams to an abrupt halt.

dialogues.speaker: DOC AND CAROL, RUNNING THROUGH THE CORNFIELD AND BACK UP
dialogues.text: DIRT road toward the highway. Doc still carries his gun i the brown wrapping paper. Carol labors with the suitcase she runs. ON THE HIGHWAY DOC STANDS IN THE MIDDLE OF THE ROAD, wavi both arms overhead. The Greyhound bus comes to a lurching halt, Doc and Carol scramble aboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOC BUYS TWO FARES FROM THE SCOWLING GREYHOUND DRIVER. Th bus again moves forward.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: DOC AND CAROL SITTING TOGETHER ON THE BUS, Doc hold- 4l4 his camouflaged gun. They lean back on their padded seats the bus jostles along the road. Suddenly... Two Police Cars pass the bus, SIRENS screamin lights turning... Doc and Carol's eyes meet... One more Black and White passes the bus and races on down road.

dialogues.speaker: DOC WEARS A SUNBEATEN LEATHER JACKET, READING A NEWSPAPER
dialogues.text: while leaning against a hot dog stand. One foot rests on suitcase. The Invicta has been re-wrapped in a laundry ba The paper is filled with news of the robbery and a mug sh of Doc. A GREY MERCURY PULLS UP NEAR THE DOGGIE DINER. Carol is driving. Doc walks up to the window of the car.

dialogues.speaker: DOC LEANS IN THROUGH THE WINDOW.
dialogues.text: DOC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you going? CAROL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: El Paso. Doc opens the door and moves into the driver's seat. DOC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much? CAROL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty eight hundred. As she looks at him, he smiles: DOC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you hungry? CAROL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not now. He drives off.

dialogues.speaker: FRAN IS CUDDLING WITH RUDY IN THE BACK SEAT.
dialogues.text: HAROLD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got to stop. RUDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as Fran!s hands move over him) I'll tell you when.

dialogues.speaker: A FRONTAGE ROAD BORDERING THE EDGE OF A GOOD-SIZED TOWN.
dialogues.text: Carol now driving,, pulls off the highway and into an "Oa drive-in restaurant. THE MERCURY COMES TO A STOP WITHIN A ROW OF CARS FACING t indoor portion of the restaurant.

dialogues.speaker: DOC AND CAROL
dialogues.text: skinny girl, wearing a brown jacket and slacks, approache the car carrying two menus. She arrives with a smile. Doc leans forward, looking past Carol at the waitress, he lif his hand, not accepting the bill of fare. DOC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's okay, honey. Two cheeseburgers; two coffees and a milkshake. GIRL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about fries? DOC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (big smile) Why not? The Car Hop walks back across the raised cement sidewalk towards the kitchen area...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HAROLD IS TIED TO A CHAIR, RUDY IS LYING ON THE BED, half clothed, eating chicken, drinking a beer, while Fran slow strips down to bra and panties.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOC AND CAROL WATCH AS THE CAR HOP PREPARES to bolt the serving tray onto the car-door window. GIRL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could you roll it up part way?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: CAROL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure thing. The girl clamps the tray to the window. The Car Hop narro her features, looking at Doc and Carol then smiles and tu and heads back toward the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: ENTRANCE TO THE DRIVE-IN'S PARKING LOT
dialogues.text: CAROL BEGINS TO EAT, she looks casually at the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: DOC SLOWLY EATS HIS CHEESEBURGER, TAKES A SIP OF MILKSHAK
dialogues.text: CAROL REACHES FOR HER COFFEE, spills it and then reaches the light switch knob on the dashboard.

dialogues.speaker: THE MERCURY'S HEADLIGHTS BLINK ON
dialogues.text: THE CAR HOP AT THE PICK-UP STAND, notes the lights 429 th turns her head the opposite direction, pretending not to

dialogues.speaker: DOC WATCHES THE WAITRESS TURN AWAY
dialogues.text: THE CAR HOP STARES AT THE CEMENT PAVEMENT. Within the kit behind her the cooks all look toward the parking lot... t faces expectant.

dialogues.speaker: DOC WATCHING THE WAITRESS
dialogues.text: DOC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She made us. Carol looks into the rear view mirror. Across the wide lo police car appears, cutting in off the highway. Doc goes into the back seat, Carol kicks the engine over, jams the stick into gear. All this is accomplished while staring into the rear view mirror. DOC LIFTS THE LAUNDRY BAG-COVERED SHOTGUN onto his lap. THE POLICE CAR cruises slowly along the line of autos...

dialogues.speaker: TWO OFFICERS SCAN THE PARKING LOT. THE PASSENGER COP CRAD
dialogues.text: a riot gun. PASSENGER COP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mercury.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: THE SQUAD CAR PULLS TO A STOP FIFTEEN FEET behind the Mercury, seemingly blocking the way. DOC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now. CAROL STANDS ON THE ACCELERATOR. THE MERCURY GOES screami forward, as Doc shoots out the back window. Then, as the terrified cops duck to the side, he shoots out their fron windshield. The Mercury bounces up across the sidewalk as empty plates and glasses topple off the serving tray and across the concrete. The car slams back down through a va space on the opposite side, and moves around in a semicir across the asphalt, heading for the highway exit. DOC SMASHES OUT THE REAR WINDOW with the butt of his shot THE BLACK AND WHITE NOW IN REVERSE, ZOOMING BACK, trying get between the Mercury and the highway.

dialogues.speaker: CAROL BRINGING THE CAR AROUND, SHE CAN SEE THE SQUAD CAR
dialogues.text: streaking backward. She pulls the wheel to the right and brings her car across the front of the still stopping Pol Car. THE OFFICERS TRY TO BRING THEIR GUNS INTO PLAY AS THE Mer streaks in front of them.

dialogues.speaker: THE POLICE CAR EXPLODES. THE HOOD IS LIFTED OFF THE CAR.
dialogues.text: Officers jump out of the vehicle, pouring shots after the retreating Mercury.

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: around her.

dialogues.speaker: THE MERCURY, BADLY RIDDLED, PULLS OUT ONTO THE HIGHWAY
dialogues.text: ANOTHER SQUAD CAR COMES SPEEDING UP in the opposite direction. The Driver hits the brakes, the tires smoke al the street as the Black and White SCREAMS to a stop.

dialogues.speaker: DOC FIRES ANOTHER TWO BURSTS...
dialogues.text: THE POLICE CAR - THE FRONT AND BACK FENDERS ARE HIT; the wheels disintegrate - the impact of the shells rocks the Black and White upward.

dialogues.speaker: THE SECOND PASSENGER COP, FIRING A .38 OUT HIS BACK WINDO
dialogues.text: the Mercury as it streaks down the road. Three holes open on the trunk of the auto. DOC CAN SEE BOTH OFFICERS JUMP OUT OF THE SECOND Black an White through the rear window. Carol makes a quick turn o the highway.

dialogues.speaker: THE MERCURY ROARS DOWN THE DARK STREET INTO THE CITY'S
dialogues.text: COMMERCIAL SECTION, suddenly slow, makes another sharp tu this time through a red light.

dialogues.speaker: DOWN A SMALLER STREET FILLED WITH SHOPS
dialogues.text: CORNER, whips up to the curb - Doc and Carol jump out of car. She carries the suitcase, he hangs onto his big gun. DOC AND CAROL, MOVING DOWN A DESERTED SIDEWALK; the SOUND sirens. They round a corner, then quickly move into an al THE ALLEY IS NARROW, DESERTED. DOC AND CAROL pull back in an alcove as a prowl car goes SCREAMING down the street a off into the night. They continue down the alley. THE OPPOSITE ENTRANCE TO THE ALLEY IS BLOCKED BY a large metal garbage container, and the DRIVER empties two cans garbage into it. Then he starts across the narrow street beyond in order to grab several others. DOC LOOKS BEHIND HIM, THEN GRABS CAROL'S ARM. They run fo the container. Doc tosses the suitcase into the container jumps in, reaches back, pulls Carol in beside him. SIRENS again sound close by. AFTER A MOMENT, A LARGE GARBAGE TRUCK PULLS UP, lifts the container with hooks and dumps the garbage and Doc and Ca into the truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INSIDE THE TRUCK. Doc and Carol start to panic, but they room enough. WITHIN THE TRUCK DOC WIGGLES HIS .45 out of his jacket an into his hand. He, Carol and the suitcase are crushed tig amongst the garbage. A moment after Doc frees his gun, a of garbage descends on their shelter, partially obscuring them.

dialogues.speaker: THE TRUCK PULLS OUT
dialogues.text: DOC AND CAROL SWEATING... BREATHING HARD. Again the SOUND sirens... the truck lurches forward.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: THE TRUCK MOVES ALONG THE EMPTY STREETS, passing several prowling squad cars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE GARBAGE MAN DRIVING THE TRUCK, MAKING STOPS, throwing more refuse. The truck continues along. DOC AND CAROL - THEIR FACES COVERED WITH PERSPIRATION and flies... buried within their enclosure under the moist garbage.

dialogues.speaker: A GARBAGE DUMP
dialogues.text: THE TRUCK GROWLS ALONG THE RUTTED PATHWAY surrounded by a of open trash. Areas within the dump reveal the slow, smouldering fires...

dialogues.speaker: THE DRIVER REVS THE ENGINE, PULLS THE BED LIFT GEAR
dialogues.text: THE TRUCK BED RISES AND TILTS FORWARD, as the load of tra tumbles down the face of the crater. DOC AND CAROL SLIDE DOWN THE MOUNTAIN OF FILTH, and stumb forward they climb into a large cardboard box. THE DRIVER GETS OUT OF THE CAB, checks to see that the garbage is gone from the truck bed. On his way back to th cab he finds a magazine to his liking near a shredded aut tire. With his newly-found prize, the Driver re-enters th truck and drives away. THE BOX LIES AT THE BOTTOM OF THE CRATER AMONGST the brok bottles, melon rinds, flashlight batteries, tin cans, use tires. DOC SAWS AT A CORNER OF THE CARDBOARD BOX with his penkni The matted paper gives away, allowing them more room with the box. DOC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay? CAROL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think so... I don't know. Doc puts his hand to her face, wiping away a thin trace o blood from a scratch. DOC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not deep.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Carol tries to smile for the first time in quite a while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No scars?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No scars. Doc looks across the garbage through the open end of the crate. THE HEAT AND THE FLIES HAVE BECOME UNBEARABLE. Carol begi to scratch her leg. DOC (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't scratch it, just rub, you'll get an infection. Carol ignores him, she is in bad shape. DOC (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Do what I tell you, it's not a game. CAROL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all a game, don't bother me. Doc stares at the garbage around them. DOC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We better stick here till tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (down) Yeah. Doc smiles, trying to get her to smile again. DOC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going to make it. CAROL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (further down) Sure... Carol rubs one hand along her now terribly soiled, tweed suit. She looks away from Doc. Doc stares at her mussed hair an tear-stained cheeks. DOC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to say something.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: CAROL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quiet defeat) I don't want to hear it. DOC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly) Listen to me. It's hard enough. Carol turns back, faces Doc. Their eyes find one another. DOC (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Look, what you said yesterday... I guess that was right. It isn't worth anything if we don't make it together. CAROL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think we can any more... If we ever get out of here, maybe I should take off... DOC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got this far. CAROL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've come a lot of miles. But we're not close to anything. DOC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess you're right. A pause. CAROL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I always thought jails make people hard. Not you. You're just not tough enough to forget about Beynon. I chose you, not him. DOC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Either we pick it up or else we leave it right here. We got to go one way or another. CAROL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (setting the condition) No more about Beynon. DOC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever happens it's over. A pause.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: CAROL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not trusting his mouth) Sounds good. DOC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to try with me? CAROL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling) Things can't get much worse can they? DOC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't see how. A long moment. CAROL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (finally talcing Doc's arm) Okay. DOC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slow smile) You and me. CAROL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we make it? DOC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We get to Mexico, we can have a life. CAROL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's all I want... It's the only thing I have ever wanted. As she pulls herself against him: DOC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to try and get it for you. They pull each other closer, tightly holding one another.

dialogues.speaker: RUDY IS LYING IN BED READING A NEWSPAPER PILLED WITH DOC
dialogues.text: CAROL. The fact that they have been seen in the North. He smiles. Fran is in the bed beside him asleep naked under the shee RUDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling softly) Harold, you've had ten minutes, get out of there. No answer. Rudy gets up and crosses to the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HAROLD IS HANGING FROM A BRACKET. Very dead and not very pretty. Rudy looks at him, then sits on the John continui to read his paper.

dialogues.speaker: DOC AND CAROL HUDDLED TOGETHER ON THE FLOOR OF THE EMPTY
dialogues.text: They hold one another tightly fighting the cold and the relentless roar of metal wheels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAROL AND DOC ARE THE ONLY CUSTOMERS. They sit in booths while their clothes are being cleaned (doors open at bott

dialogues.speaker: OVERNIGHT BAGS.
dialogues.text: Cannon watches them from across the room, carefully clean his teeth with a cinnamon toothpick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LAUGHLIN LEADS RUDY AND FRAN down the dark-walled hallway stopping before room number 4l8. Laughlin turns the key i the lock, opens the door. LAUGHLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's hard to figure. There's something about the composition of the track at Pimlico... You can't go by the clock, any speed horse, take a second off any other track in the country.

dialogues.speaker: AS THE GROUP ENTERS.
dialogues.text: LAUGHLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) ... but a speed horse is the only thing that consistently holds form. They got to let 'em run, dumb God damn trainers try to rate 'em, just breaks their heart. Rudy kicks the door shut with a slam, grabs Laughlin's shoulder, spins him around, hits him full in the stomach. Laughlin begins to fall Rudy catches him, wallops him aga in the mid-section, then throws him back into a ratty armchair. Rudy instantly pulls out his .44 and shoves it against Laughlin's mouth. RUDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, sweetpea, you get two choices. Live or die. RUDY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do what I tell you, you not only get to live, but maybe you'll pick up some money. LAUGHLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still breathless) Just tell me. RUDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First things first. Main thing, you work for me, otherwise I get you. If I don't, six months from now one of my friends will.

dialogues.speaker: THE ACCOUNTANT HANGS UP THE PHONE.
dialogues.text: ACCOUNTANT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: El Paso. Laughlin's. Rudy's arrived.

dialogues.speaker: LAUGHLIN PICKS UP THE PHONE.
dialogues.text: LAUGHLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, Doc. I can do it. Just like old times... Yeah, it's a nervous way to live.

dialogues.speaker: CAROL AND DOC SIT ON A WOODEN BENCH AT A PARK NEAR THE HO
dialogues.text: THE BLACK SUITCASE is on the ground. ACROSS THE STREET FROM THE BENCH IS LAUGHLIN'S. FOUR stor of red brick.

dialogues.speaker: DOC ENTERS AND CROSSES TO LAUGHLIN WHO IS BEHIND THE DESK
dialogues.text: The switchboard is now vacant. DOC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy. How's it going? LAUGHLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking hands, laughing) Good to see you, Doc. (handing him a paper) It's all there, departure, arrival - everything except the $500. Doc pays him, looks closely into his eyes. Jimmy hasn't changed and it's set. DOC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's Mama and the kids? LAUGHLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Growing -- all of them - every day. (then) 318, you'll be the only ones on the floor. DOC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My lady'11 come in in about five minutes. Have some food sent up in half an hour. LAUGHLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just sandwiches... DOC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He picks up the room key. Doc starts for the elevator. DOC (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When she gets here, have that kid of yours help her with the suitcase. LAUGHLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He took the day off. DOC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you do it. LAUGHLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't leave the desk. Doc gives Laughlin a half-pissed look, then crosses to th elevator and pulls the cage door open. LAUGHLIN WATCHES THE RICKETY, self-service elevator move upward. He reaches for the desk phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRAN, WEARING ONLY A BATHROBE, is doing her nails while watching an old movie on the black and white tube, seated the bed. The phone begins to RING. Fran looks over to Rudy from her overstuffed armchair. RUDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, Grunt, pick it up.

dialogues.speaker: CAROL EMERGES THROUGH THE SLIDING DOOR AND TURNS DOWN THE
dialogues.text: CORRIDOR. She walks slowly, carrying the heavy suitcase. Reaching the door to room 31oj Carol knocks rapidly three times, waits, then raps out two sets of two knocks. The d swings open and Doc stands within the archway. She enters Doc shuts the door and slips his arms around Carol, revea his .45 automatic in one hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RUDY IS SPINNING THE CHAMBER on his .44 then shoves it in his coat pocket. Fran is getting dressed in the middle of room, her breasts and thighs ripple outward from the conf of the bra and girdle. THE CALICO KITTEN SLEEPS PEACEFULLY IN ITS cardboard box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAROL IS IN THE SHOWER, STEAM HANGS IN THE AIR as she vigorously soaps her body, cleansing herself of the resid left from their cross-country flight. DOC IN THE MAIN ROOM IS STANDING AT THE LARGE windows fac across to the building next to Laughlins. The fire escape one story beneath him. Doc crosses, throws the suitcase o the bed, undoes the straps and snaps, lifts the lid open. stares at the huge amount of money for a moment, then dig into the suitcase, reaching down to the bottom. He withdr his hand, holding four visas.. He puts two of them on the bureau drawer top... the other two he begins to tear into sections and places them into a large ashtray. He touches match to the scraps. THE FLAMES CURL AROUND RUDY'S PHOTOGRAPH in the ashtray.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE BED IN DOC AND CAROL'S ROOM, THE SUITCASE IS NOW
dialogues.text: CLOSED; the .45 automatic sits beside it... Doc's overcoa also lies across the bedpsread, near it the wrapped shotg The poster is again on the wall. CAROL still in the bathroom of room 318. She wears only a slip. Carol is washing out her bra and panties in the washbasin, using a coarse bar of soap. Doc enters; he beg taking off his shirt. DOC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got some food coming, should be here any minute. CAROL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great. I'm going to sleep twelve hours. DOC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ten. Laughlin's going to take us across at four A.M. CAROL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mild complaint) Oh, Jesus... how?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: DOC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeep. There's a dry river bed fifteen miles east. He takes us to the Mexican side, drops us off at the airfield by breakfast... we've got a 9 o'clock flight. CAROL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles) I'll be ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (down) Yeah. CAROL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong? DOC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugs) I don't know. CAROL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get in the shower. You'll feel okay. DOC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smile) Whatever you say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AS RUDY AND FRAN EMERGE FROM THEIR ROOM. The door shuts behind them, Rudy guides Fran to the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: DOC STANDS IN THE SHOWER, THE HARD SPRAY BREAKING OVER TH
dialogues.text: BACK OF HIS SKULL. Tired, he closes his eyes, rests the s of his head against the tile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAROL STILL WEARING THE SLIP, she lies back across the be Her eyelids slowly fall shut. Carol has pushed the suitca overcoat and .45 off to one side. RUDY AND FRAN COME DOWN THE STAIRS. Rudy puts one hand in his overcoat.

dialogues.speaker: AS THE HOOD DRIVES, SWAIN IS BESIDE HIM IN THE FRONT, CUL
dialogues.text: THE ACCOUNTANT AND HAYHOE ride in the back seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAROL IS NAPPING LIGHTLY ON THE BED AS DOC BURSTS out of bathroom... again dressed in his shorts, holding his pant one hand. DOC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get upI Carol's eyes snap open. DOC (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) We're moving now! He quickly pulls his pants on... CAROL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it? DOC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laughlin. He's always got his family around... that wife and kid of his have to stand by his side to make sure he stays off the juice and horses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If they are not here, he must have sent them away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RUDY AND FRAN STEP INTO THE HALLWAY TOWARD ROOM 3l8a pass several rooms. Fran's face is taut. Rudy starts his nervo grin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAROL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hard) Get your clothes on, move your butt. She looks at him, doesn't move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. Look, I'm clean. I want to get some rest.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She is interrupted by a hard knock on the door. Doc drops shirt to the floor. He quickly reaches down, lifts his .4 Doc gestures to Carol... she moves towards the door. CAROL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing; now at doorway) Who is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fran stands at the door to 318. Rudy is at her shoulder; has taken out his revolver. FRAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's your food, I brought up your sandwiches... INSIDE 318

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carol standing near the door., looks at Doc. He mouths and half-whispers: DOC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stall. Doc whips his pen knife out of his pocket, crosses the ro to the locked door of an adjoining hotel room. He begins forcing the lock. CAROL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just leave it outside the door... I'm not dressed right now. After a moment: FRAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't do that, ma'am. You have to pay now so I can pay back the boy that went out and got the food... DOC working on the door; his .45 shoved into the waistban his pants. CAROL thinking hard... CAROL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right. You'll have to hold on a minute, my husband's in the shower... DOC breaks the lock and opens the door -- he quickly cros the dark apartment, moves to the front door, slips out hi automatic, then gingerly cracks the door. His eyes tighte amazement as he sees:

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: RUDY STANDING SLIGHTLY BEHIND FRAN, his .44 held tightly to the door jamb, ready for instantaneous use. Rudy and F are 15 feet down the hallway from Doc's slightly opened d They both have their backs turned to him in three-quarter fashion. DOC BAREFOOTED., BARE-CHESTED; he decides on a course of action. The door swings quietly open. WITHIN THE HALLWAY, DOC CLOSES THE DISTANCE between himse and Rudy in two swift strides, Rudy turns,, swinging his too late, as Doc's .45 crashes against his head. Rudy dro Fran screams. Rudy looks at Doc, still smiling, eyes glaz He falls abruptly. Doc stands over the fallen body. Fran continues to scream. Doc finally turns away from Rudy, looking now at the screaming woman. He flattens her with left hook to the jaw. Fran drops to the floor as if she h been shot. Suddenly everything in the corridor is silent. RUDY'S HEAD IS BLOODIED. He lies without movement.

dialogues.speaker: DOC NOW SLAMS AT THE DOOR OF 318
dialogues.text: DOC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open it up, it's me. Carol swings the door open. Doc bursts back into the room grabs his shirt, begins to button it. DOC (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Come on, come on. CAROL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who was it? DOC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just get your clothes on...

dialogues.speaker: THE FOURTH FLOOR CORRIDOR
dialogues.text: AS DOC AND CAROL COME BACK OUT OF 318 they step over the fallen bodies and start toward the waiting elevator. Carol stops as she recognizes Rudy. Doc pulls her along, forcing her to keep moving. Carol again carries the brown suitcase, Doc holds the shotgun. They go down the back (o front) stairs.

dialogues.speaker: THE ACCOUNTANT STANDS AT ONE CORNER OP THE RECEPTION COUN
dialogues.text: IN THE LOBBY OF LAUGHLINS. Within an alcove behind and to side of the desk (the area serving as an office) Cully, S and Hayhoe have stretched Laughlin across the pine desk. Accountant eyes both the empty lobby and the entrance to hotel3 acting as lookout. CULLY INSIDE THE ALCOVE LIFTS A SNAPPED OFF LEG of the he chair to use as a club. The thug turns back to the desk w Swain and Hayhoe have Laughlin pinioned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just tell us the room number. LAUGHLIN LOOKS BACK AT CULLY. He is very frightened but s nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now you want to tell me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCoy's in 318., the other guy's in 420.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure about that? He again whacks Laughlin's knee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOC AND CAROL EMERGE,, MOVING QUICKLY FOR THE. main entra They get five steps before simultaneously seeing the Accountant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doc ! Doc and Carol freeze for an instant. The Accountant snaps his fingers twice. Cully lowers his club, looks to the Accountant, as do Swa and Hayhoe. The Accountant smiles, staring at Doc and Car

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calmly to his men) Out here.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: CULLY, SWAIN AND HAYHOE APPEAR FROM THE ALCOVE BEHIND the Accountant. They look over his shoulder toward the rear o the hotel, their eyes finding Doc and Carol.

dialogues.speaker: DOC HAS ONE HAND IN HIS OUTSIDE COAT POCKET, WRAPPED
dialogues.text: around the .45. Carol continues to hold the suitcase up i front of herself, almost like a shield. The distance betw Doc and Carol and the hotel entrance has been effectively off by the four opponents standing near the reception des Carol edges backward a few steps, toward the massive wood staircase. ACCOUNTANT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just have her set it down. Doc's hand comes out of his coat pocket, a slow gesture revealing that his palm is empty. DOC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want it? Come and take it.

dialogues.speaker: THE ACCOUNTANT NOW PLANKED BY THE THREE MEN
dialogues.text: ACCOUNTANT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly) Get him. As the three men reach for their guns. DOC MOVES MUCH PASTER. HE DUCKS TO   THE RIGHT, levels th disguised shotgun and fires in the   same movement. The reception desk near the Accountant   splinters from the b and he is hit painfully. The other   three men duck away the sudden burst of fire power.

dialogues.speaker: DOC AND CAROL JUMP FOR THE STAIRS
dialogues.text: HAYHOE LEVELS HIS PISTOL AT THE RETREATING COUPLE Another shot from Doc's riot gun... this one breaking open the fl at Hayhoe's feet and cutting him down at the knees. Canno Cully, Swain and Max open fire as they dive for cover. Th miss their shots, digging up walls, stairs and flooring. ON THE WINDING STAIRWAY DOC AND CAROL FLEE UPWARD She struggles with the heavy suitcase, Doc transfers the riot to his left hand, pulls out the more accurate .45 to use his right.

dialogues.speaker: WITHIN THE LOBBY THE SIX MEN SPLIT FORCES
dialogues.text: Cully and the Accountant run to the elevator, enter it, p the door shut. Swain and Hayhoe, limping, and Cannon and start for the stairwell in direct pursuit of Doc and Caro All the men, save the Accountant, now have guns in their hands. SWAIN AND HAYHOE CAUTIOUSLY GOING UPWARD. Still below the first level landing, their eyes search overhead. The SOUN Doc and Carol's pounding feet can be heard. HAYHOE LEANS OUT OVER THE BANISTER, points his gun direct up and fires. DOC AND CAROL BETWEEN THE FIRST AND SECOND FLOOR landings Hayhoe's bullet tears by, ripping through the wooden bani supports. INSIDE THE ELEVATOR THE ACCOUNTANT AND CULLY WATCH the ar indicator pass "Two." DOC AIMING HIS .45 RESTING IT ON THE BANISTER He fires tw shots back down the stairwell. SWAIN AND HAYHOE MOVING UP THE STEPS TWO AT A TIME Sudden Hayhoe's leg buckles as a .45 slug tears through his hip, other bullet ripping the plaster wall near his shoulder. SWAIN IS NOW BESIDE THE BANISTER, he points his 54l revol straight up... empties it. DOC AND CAROL AS SWAIN'S BULLETS BREAK AROUND THEM. Doc p Carol down, lifts the riot gun and fires down the stairwe with a huge roar. THE STAIRCASE TEN FEET IN FRONT OF SWAIN IS SMASHED by Do blast. Swain has to climb over the uprooted planking to continue moving upward. Cannon following.

dialogues.speaker: THE ELEVATOR INDICATOR STOPPING AT "THREE"
dialogues.text: CULLY PULLS OPEN THE DOOR, MOVES OUT INTO THE corridor. T Accountant remains within the elevator.

dialogues.speaker: SWAIN ON THE STAIRWAY FIRES HIS PISTOL UPWARD
dialogues.text: CAROL, ON THE STAIRWAY ABOVE, AS THE SHOTS SMASH PAST, ru ahead of Doc by three steps. They pass the second landing keep moving upwards towards the third.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Doc's focus of attention is downward. He knows that he an Carol are being pursued up the stairwell, but he isn't aw of the fact that the gunsels have split their forces.

dialogues.speaker: RUDY ON THE THIRD FLOOR AGAIN RISES LIKE LAZARUS FROM THE
dialogues.text: DEAD. His head bloodied from Doc's heavy pistol, he slowl wobbles to his feet. Rudy looks down at Fran... she sobs violently, her back leaning against the wall. Rudy picks his .44 then stumbles into the open door of Doc and Carol room. He unsteadily crosses to the bathroom, closes the d CAROL FRANTICALLY MOVING UPWARD, DOC HAS NOW FALLEN five steps behind.

dialogues.speaker: SWAIN ON THE THIRD FLOOR
dialogues.text: Cully walks cautiously down the corridor, pistol raised. moves toward the landing, having covered one quarter of t distance from the elevator. The Accountant is still withi the elevator. Carol comes up the stairwell and looks back for Doc. The SOUND of Swain's pistol and Doc's answering .45. Carol se a movement; she turns and sees Cully's gun leveled at her Carol screams: Doc dives onto the landing facing the corridor... his pla of movement knee high.,, the riot gun in his left hand, . in his right. CULLY IS HIT IN THE CHEST BY BUCKSHOT. The killing wounds fling him upward as he fires his own gun... his aim destr by the death blows,, the bullets stray above Carol, high their mark.

dialogues.speaker: THE CORRIDOR WALL NEAR THE ELEVATOR IS SMASHED BY ONE OF
dialogues.text: riot gun's jumbo shots, as is the top of the elevator. Th plaster flies away revealing further damage. The cables a smashed, the elevator breaks loose and plummets downward.

dialogues.speaker: THE EMERGENCY CABLE, INSIDE THE SHAFT
dialogues.text: THE MECHANISM TRANSFERS OVER, line catching within the pu housing. The line snaps taut - halting the speeding car.

dialogues.speaker: AS THE ELEVATOR SLAMS TO A WRENCHING STOP FIVE FEET
dialogues.text: ABOVE the floor level. The Accountant bounces from the fl of the car to the ceiling, then back to the floor. Laughlin leans across the reception desk in great pain. H sees the suspended car through the iron grill door. The Accountant lies completely still on the floor of the elevator. His head and neck twisted at an oblique angle.

dialogues.speaker: DOC ON THE THIRD FLOOR LANDING
dialogues.text: HE JAMS SEVERAL SHELLS INTO HIS RIOT GUN WHILE HOLDING hi .45 ready for an appearance by Swain. Reloading completed stands, with Carol. He again begins to move upward.

dialogues.speaker: SWAIN FIRES FROM THE STAIRWELL
dialogues.text: DOC STOPS, SETS BOTH THE RIOT GUN AND THE .45 on 562 the banister... He waits... on the winding staircase below hi there is a dark movement.

dialogues.speaker: DOC FIRES BOTH GUNS
dialogues.text: THE STAIRWELL AROUND SWAIN DISINTEGRATES. The thug is obliterated by the firepower. DOC CANNOT SEE THE EFFECT OF HIS SHOTS. He again resumes flight upward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RUDY HOLDS HIS BLOODY HEAD IN THE SINK BOWL, DUMBLY splas water over himself. Carol's underwear is still present. Rudy's pistol lies on the soap tray. THE LANDING AS DOC AND CAROL COME POUNDING INTO VIEW. No further avenues open, they turn down the corridor. Doc gr Carol and pushes her into the room, past Fran; he kicks t door shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOC GRABS THE SUITCASE, RUNS TO THE WINDOW, TEARS off the shade, lifts the frame, looks. The drop is too far. He gr Carol and runs into the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THEY RUN DOWN TWO DOORS AND BREAK IN. Over the door is th sign "Fire Escape."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOC HELPS CAROL OUT ONTO THE FIRE ESCAPE. He aids her wit his left hand, the riot gun now clutched tightly in his right. He motions, she hands him the suitcase and follows

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THEY DESCEND THE FIRE ESCAPE. They reach the end. The fir escape stays rigid. Doc cautiously steps on to the tilted steps. He turns and with the suitcase crosses to the end. Throws the bag and shotgun across the 6 foot gap to the retaining wall, preparing to jump. RUDY COMES OUT OF THE ROOM ONTO THE FIRE ESCAPE holding h .44. He looks down at Doc, then slowly raises his gun. Ca screams. DOC JUMPS. RUDY FIRES. DOC IS HIT IN THE SIDE (flesh woun In the air he spins and lands. Rudy fires again and again he runs down the fire escape. Doc rolls, picks up the sho and fires. RUDY'S TIME HAS COME. THE JUMBO CHARGES MASH HIM BACK aga the wall and off the fire escape. CAROL RUNS ALMOST STAGGERING AND GETS READY TO JUMP the s feet. THE FIRE ESCAPE. BEGINS TO SINK. CAROL LOOKS AT DOC mutel as she sinks beneath the retaining wall. DOC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (his hand out) Jump! And she does. He catches her and pulls her up. They look at one another for a long moment, then he stand and helps her to her feet, and leaving the shotgun behind they walk into the alley.

dialogues.speaker: RUDY LIES DEAD BEHIND THEM
dialogues.text: IN A PARKING LOT AT THE END OF THE ALLEY, SLIM, a tough, grizzly Western is about to pull out. Doc opens the back and Carol gets in. Doc opens the front door as Slim turns looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: DOC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (.45 in hand, pointing) Drive. SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suit yourself. He lets out a yell and guns across the lot over the four drop to the sidewalk and into and off a car and into the street. SLIM (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grinning) How was that? DOC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling in spite of himself) Just fine. SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where we go in1? DOC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mexico. I'd like to find a quiet place to cross. SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not? The car pulls forward as the light blinks to green.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AS THE CAR PASSES AN INTERSECTION, SEVERAL POLICE cars ca seen arriving at the front of Laughlins. The car continues moving up the street, then makes a righ onto a larger boulevard. Doc half turns to Carol. DOC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay? CAROL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nodding) Where do we go from here? DOC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, airport I guess.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: CAROL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They will have our description before we can get a plane. DOC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (way down) Yeah. SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess you ain't gonna shoot me, are you? DOC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I kinda doubt it. Slim is obviously pleased that some excitement has come i his life. SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's good... I'll cooperate, don't worry about that... yes sir, I've had some trouble with the law myself. Doc and Carol look at the man. SLIM (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three years ago I dynamited some fish at the reservoir. CAROL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beginning to laugh) Oh my God. SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That little job cost me a hundred dollars... didn't even get to keep the fish. DOC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (resigned to the insanity of the moment) Let's just get to the border. SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure thing, mister, it's coming right up. 'Bout an hour. Quiet crossing that is.

dialogues.speaker: THE AMERICAN OFFICIALS SIMPLY WAVE THE CAR BY.
dialogues.text: At the white line a Mexican CUSTOMS OFFICER emerges from station house. As he looks inside the car:

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: OFFICIAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buenas tardes... Your destination. SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (speaking right up) Chihuahua... gonna do some sightseeing. The Official smiles and motions them past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which way? DOC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Juarez - Chihuahua City road. SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you want to go to the airport?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not now. CAROL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long before this car's hot? DOC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a moment) Pull over. Slim stops the car near the soft shoulder of the dirt roa Doc looks at Slim. DOC (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Listen... how much money did you make this year? SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slightly offended) What's it to you? DOC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (patient) Come on. How much? SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Bout five thousand.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: DOC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about if I buy your car for ten grand? SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You serious? DOC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure am. SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I keep my mouth shut? DOC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I want. SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't report the car and I don't know either of you? DOC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got it. SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about twenty thousand? -DOC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about thirty? SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (delighted) Done, by God. Doc turns to Carol. DOC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pay the man. As she begins to open the suitcase...

dialogues.speaker: DOC LOOKS AT SLIM
dialogues.text: DOC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going to have to walk back to the border. SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry about me, I'll grab a cab... I can afford it, you know.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Slim steps out of the car, Carol moves into the front sea Doc slides behind the wheel. SLIM (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing, leaning through the window) Hope you get to where you're going. CAROL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. Hope you do too. SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By the way, you're getting a hell of a car there, mister. DOC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs) Well, I paid a hell of a price. Now for God's sake keep your mouth shut. SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (his pride hurt) Wish you hadn't said that. When Slim Canfield's lips are sealed, they're sealed. DOC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles) Go with God. DOC SLIPS THE CAR into gear. SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One thing though... how do I explain this to my wife? CAROL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell her you robbed a bank... The car pulls forward. Slim waves goodbye, then turns and begins walking back down the highway.

dialogues.speaker: BACK INSIDE THE CAR, DOC ACCELERATES AWAY
dialogues.text: CAROL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are we going to make it? DOC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell, I don't know... but we sure gave it a run.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: CAROL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (positive with a small smile) Whatever happens... we're going all the way. DOC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles) Yeah, why not? We're the good guys. CAROL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess we are. After a moment: DOC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you try the news? Carol snaps on the radioj the voice of a Mexican announce heard. CAROL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No more news, from now on we're just going to listen to music. She spins the dial. Mariachi music comes on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We walk. THEY ARE WALKING ALONG THE HIGHWAY, THE EDSEL IS now a do the background. Another dot appears, grows bigger, as it closer it is a bus. Very Mexican but very Greyhound in appearance. Doc and Carol turn, Doc flags it down. It pulls to a stop, they board. The bus pulls out.

dialogues.speaker: DOC PAYS AND THEN FOLLOWS CAROL TO A SEAT.
dialogues.text: They sit. Mexico rolls by outside the window. They look at each other and smile.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: VOICE (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! Doc and Carol look back. THE BLACK PANTHER IS LEANING OVER THE SEAT, his empty fis cocked up like a pistol. He grins. BLACK PANTHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pulling the trigger) Bang! Doc and Carol look at him. FREEZE FRAME.
